sabcPolitics.headline: President Ramaphosa pays tribute to young people
sabcPolitics.lede: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa says throughout history young people have been a driving force for change.

sabcPolitics.headline: COPE calls on government to better acknowledge liberation heroes
sabcPolitics.lede: The Congress of the People (COPE) has called for the iconic Orlando Stadium be named after student leader Tsietsi Mashinini.

sabcPolitics.headline: FeesMustFall an important march since 1976 Soweto Uprisings
sabcPolitics.lede: FeesMustFall was the most important student protest since the Soweto Uprisings of 1976.

sabcPolitics.headline: Ramaphosa to answer questions from the National Assembly this week
sabcPolitics.lede: President Cyril Ramaphosa will be in Parliament this week to answer oral questions from members of the National Assembly for the first time since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

sabcPolitics.headline: Speaker to ensure Secrecy Bill meets constitutional requirements
sabcPolitics.lede: Speaker of the National Assembly Thandi Modise says she will make sure that the Protection of State Information Bill meets the constitutional requirements as envisaged by President Cyril Ramaphosa.

sabcPolitics.headline: Khoi community elated as Parliament approves National Khoi and San Heritage Route
sabcPolitics.lede: Cabinet's approval of the National Khoi and San Heritage Route, which is a national legacy project, is widely welcomed by the Khoi and San community in the Eastern Cape.

sabcPolitics.headline: Relevance of youth organisations in current political climate under spotlight
sabcPolitics.lede: Young people in South Africa have always been at the forefront of the liberation struggle.

sabcPolitics.headline: Tributes pour in for former ANC stalwart Makunyane
sabcPolitics.lede: The family members of the late African National Congress (ANC) stalwart and former Polokwane Mayor, Thabo Makunyane say they are still devastated following his death.

sabcPolitics.headline: Speaker Modise sends invitations to panel members selected to probe Mkhwebane
sabcPolitics.lede: National Assembly Speaker Thandi Modise has sent out invitation letters to three persons she intends to appoint on the panel to conduct a preliminary assessment about whether there is prima facie evidence that Public Protector Busisiwe Mkhwebane has committed misconduct and is incompetent.

sabcPolitics.headline: Protesters want Cecil John Rhodes’ statue in Kimberley removed
sabcPolitics.lede: Academics, writers and artists in Kimberley, in the Northern Cape, are demanding that the local municipality remove a statue of Cecil John Rhodes.

sabcPolitics.headline: VIDEO: President Ramaphosa receives Lesotho Prime Minister Dr. Moeketsi Majoro
sabcPolitics.lede: President Cyril Ramaphosa receives Lesotho Prime Minister Dr. Moeketsi Majoro.  Dr. Majoro became Prime Minister on May 20th 2020, replacing Tom Thabane who effectively resigned from the position on May 19th.

sabcPolitics.headline: SAHRC welcomes the Electoral Act ruling
sabcPolitics.lede: The South African Human Rights Commission (SAHRC) has welcomed the judgment handed down by the Constitutional Court that declares parts of the Electoral Act unconstitutional.

sabcPolitics.headline: Makhura urged to intervene in allegations of under spending by Social Development
sabcPolitics.lede: The Democratic Alliance (DA) has called on Gauteng Premier, David Makhura to intervene over allegations of under spending by the province's Department of Social Development.

sabcPolitics.headline: Political parties widely welcome ruling nullifying parts of the Electoral Act
sabcPolitics.lede: The Constitutional Court judgment, which declared that independent candidates can contest the national elections, has been widely welcomed. Independent candidates were only allowed to contest local government elections previously.

sabcPolitics.headline: City of Tshwane remains under administration pending court battle
sabcPolitics.lede: The City of Tshwane remains under administration pending a court battle in the Supreme Court of Appeal in Bloemfontein.

sabcPolitics.headline: Constitutional Court rules Electoral Act unconstitutional
sabcPolitics.lede: The Constitutional Court has declared the Electoral Act unconstitutional - meaning independent candidates are allowed to contest for national and provincial elections without being a member of a political party.

sabcPolitics.headline: VIDEO: Constitutional Court judgment on constitutionality of Electoral Act regarding independent candidates
sabcPolitics.lede: Is the Electoral Act unconstitutional to the extent that it does not provide for adult citizens to be elected to the National and Provincial Legislatures as independent candidates?

sabcPolitics.headline: ANC confirms passing of MP Dorah Dlamini
sabcPolitics.lede: The African National Congress (ANC) has confirmed that one of its MPs Dorah Dlamini has passed away.

sabcPolitics.headline: ANC in KZN concerned about killing of members
sabcPolitics.lede: The African National Congress (ANC) in KwaZulu-Natal has registered its concern about what seems to be the resurgence of the killing of party members in the province

sabcPolitics.headline: Ramaphosa expresses sadness over untimely passing of Nkurunziza
sabcPolitics.lede: President Cyril Ramaphosa has expressed sadness at the passing of Burundian President Pierre Nkurunziza 55, who unexpectedly passed on Monday following a short illness.

sabcPolitics.headline: Mixed reactions to the possible ban of alcohol in the Eastern Cape
sabcPolitics.lede: The decision by Eastern Cape Premier Oscar Mabuyane to lobby the National Coronavirus Command Council to re-instate the ban on alcohol sale in the province has been met with mixed reactions.

sabcPolitics.headline: Colleges were not able to open on time: Nzimande
sabcPolitics.lede: Higher Education Minister, Blade Nzimande has rejected as absurd an allegation by the Democratic Alliance  that the National Student Financial Aid Scheme is going to write-off historic debt.

sabcPolitics.headline: Scopa prepares to subpoena SA Express liquidators
sabcPolitics.lede: Parliament's Standing Committee on Public Accounts is preparing to subpoena the liquidators of SA Express if they fail to appear again next week.

sabcPolitics.headline: Malema calls on Black people across the world to unite in the fight against racism
sabcPolitics.lede: EFF leader Julius Malema has called on all Black people across the world to unite and intensify the fight against racism. He was speaking in Pretoria at the US Embassy offices, showing support for African Americans who have been protesting against the killing of George Floyd by a White police officer.

sabcPolitics.headline: EFF to hold nationwide protest against the murder of George Floyd
sabcPolitics.lede: The Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) is expected to hold a nationwide protest against the murder of African American, George Floyd Monday.

sabcPolitics.headline: Ramaphosa signs political funding disclosure bill into law
sabcPolitics.lede: President Cyril Ramaphosa has signed the Promotion of Access to Information Amendment Act into law.

sabcPolitics.headline: IPID Amendment Bill another step towards its independence: CASAC
sabcPolitics.lede: The signing of the Independent Police Investigative Directorate (IPID) Amendment Bill into law is just one step towards securing the independence of the Directorate. This is according to the Council for the Advancement of the South African Constitution (CASAC).

sabcPolitics.headline: DA calls on Ramaphosa to discipline Mapisa-Nqakula over the Khosa probe
sabcPolitics.lede: The Democratic Alliance (DA) has called on President Cyril Ramaphosa to either discipline or replace Defence and Military Veterans Minister, Nosiviwe Mapisa-Nqakula.

sabcPolitics.headline: Jacob Zuma: from calling out critical former leaders to being an ANC critic
sabcPolitics.lede: Former president Jacob Zuma, at the height of his presidency, lashed out at former leaders of the ANC who criticised the party in public; among them, former president Kgalema Motlanthe.

sabcPolitics.headline: Mlangeni thanks South Africans as 95th birthday well wishes continue to pour in
sabcPolitics.lede: Struggle stalwart, Andrew Mlangeni, who is celebrating his 95th birthday on Saturday, has thanked South Africans for the well wishes that have been streaming in from across the country.

sabcScience.headline: UK funds human trials of potential COVID-19 vaccine from Imperial
sabcScience.lede: Scientists at Imperial College London will start the first clinical trials of a potential COVID-19 vaccine this week with more than 45 million pounds ($56.50 million) in backing from the UK government and philanthropic donors.

sabcScience.headline: Credit from Safaricom’s farming app sows seeds of change in Kenya
sabcScience.lede: Rachel Bor’s neighbours chatted, laughed and shared milky tea from her tarnished kettle as they celebrated their most bountiful maize crop yet on her half-acre plot in Kenya’s Rift Valley.

sabcScience.headline: UN human rights expert asks to give evidence in SA’s air pollution case
sabcScience.lede: A United Nations human rights expert wants to submit evidence in a lawsuit against the South African government over its alleged failure to address long-term air pollution linked to burning coal, court papers show.

sabcScience.headline: SA nuclear energy prospects costly: EarthLife Africa
sabcScience.lede: Earthlife Africa has voiced opposition to the possibility of South Africa's use of nuclear power in the future, saying it has a negative climate change impact and is costly.

sabcScience.headline: CORONAVIRUS: Your daily update
sabcScience.lede: Latest COVID-19 stats as at 9 June 2020: South Africa's latest COVID-19 confirmed cases jump to 52 991. The death toll rises by 82 on Tuesday to 1 162. The recoveries now at 29 006, according to the Health Department's latest figures.

sabcScience.headline: SA’s COVID-19 cases surpass the 70 000 mark
sabcScience.lede: The number of coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in South African has surpassed the 70 000 mark. The Department of Health has on Sunday reported 4 302 new cases, bringing the cumulative number of cases to 70 038.

sabcScience.headline: New app to help with self-screening for COVID-19
sabcScience.lede: A new app "Keep out COVID" created by online technology, Howler, will allow individuals to screen themselves for coronavirus ( COVID-19) through their phones using the app.

sabcScience.headline: Veri-Quik provides graduates with a secure, verifiable link to their degrees, diplomas
sabcScience.lede: The COVID-19 pandemic has already changed the way we live and upended rituals and doings we have held dear for generations.

sabcScience.headline: FEATURE: What you need to know about digital transformation
sabcScience.lede: As many businesses across the world continue to feel the effects of the lockdown due to the deadly coronavirus pandemic, experts believe that lots of business owners will be forced to change their business model – and go digital.

sabcScience.headline: Canada’s spy agency warned of ‘shock waves’ after arrest of Huawei founder’s daughter
sabcScience.lede: Canada’s intelligence agency warned that arresting the daughter of billionaire Huawei founder Ren Zheng would set off global “shock waves” and seriously affect ties with China, just before her detention in Vancouver on a US extradition request, new court documents show.

sabcScience.headline: SA’s coronavirus confirmed cases sit at 65 736 with 1 423 deaths
sabcScience.lede: The number of coronavirus cases in South Africa now sits at 65 736. In the last 24 hours, 69 coronavirus related fatalities have been reported, bringing the overall number to 1 423 coronavirus related deaths so far.

sabcScience.headline: AstraZeneca agrees to supply Europe with 400 mln doses of COVID-19 vaccine
sabcScience.lede: British drug maker AstraZeneca says it has signed a contract with Italy, Germany, France and the Netherlands to supply Europe with a vaccine against the coronavirus, with deliveries starting by the end of this year.

sabcScience.headline: Winde welcomes NHLS steps to reduce COVID-19 test results backlog
sabcScience.lede: Western Cape Premier, Alan Winde, has welcomed the steps that the National Health Laboratory Service has put in place to reduce the backlog of the province's test results.

sabcScience.headline: Concerns of COVID-19, seasonal flu impact by health experts
sabcScience.lede: Health experts are concerned about the impact on South Africans having both COVID-19 and seasonal influenza at the same time.

sabcScience.headline: Popular Blood Pressure Medicines Do Not Put Patients at Greater COVID-19 Risk, New Study Finds
sabcScience.lede: New research offers reassuring evidence to hundreds of millions of people with high blood pressure that popular anti-hypertension drugs do not put them at greater risk from COVID-19 as some experts had feared.

sabcScience.headline: Mental illness heightened among children during global lockdowns: UN
sabcScience.lede: The United Nations (UN) says mental illnesses, such as depression, saw a major spike among children during the coronavirus lockdown around the world.

sabcScience.headline: VIDEO: Weekly Global COVID-19 Wrap, 12 June
sabcScience.lede: In this week's Global COVID-19 Wrap, SABC News captures highlights from the African continent, Europe, Asia, and the Americas - as the number of confirmed infections worldwide rise.

sabcScience.headline: Pretoria clinic closed after employees test positive for COVID-19
sabcScience.lede: The City of Tshwane's FF Ribeiro Clinic, situated at the Sammy Marks Square shopping complex in the Pretoria CBD has been temporarily closed after two staff members tested positive for the coronavirus.

sabcScience.headline: Eastern Cape facing challenges in tracing COVID-19 related cases
sabcScience.lede: Health Minister, Dr. Zweli Mkhize, says the Eastern Cape is facing challenges tracing contacts of COVID-19 related cases.

sabcScience.headline: Spider-Man, Gran Turismo among games for new PS5, Sony says
sabcScience.lede: Sony Corp on Friday unveiled a host of titles for its upcoming PlayStation 5 console, including a sequel to its hit ‘Spider-Man’ title and the latest ‘Gran Turismo’ racer, as it builds anticipation ahead of the planned year-end launch.

sabcScience.headline: Twitter takes down Beijing-backed influence operation pushing coronavirus messages
sabcScience.lede: Twitter on Thursday said it removed more than 170 000 accounts tied to a Beijing-backed influence operation that deceptively spread messages favorable to the Chinese government, including about the coronavirus.

sabcScience.headline: Debunking myths regarding COVID-19 with Dr Mvuyisi Mzukwa
sabcScience.lede: In this episode, the similarity between flu and COVID-19 symptoms is discussed.

sabcScience.headline: US could reach 200 000 coronavirus deaths in September, expert says
sabcScience.lede: The United States may see 200 000 deaths because of the coronavirus at some point in September, a leading expert said, while total US coronavirus cases surpassed 2 million on Wednesday as governments relax restrictions.

sabcScience.headline: South Korean doctors find risk factors for severe COVID-19 cases
sabcScience.lede: South Korean doctors have found certain underlying conditions that may make some COVID-19 patients more severely affected by the disease, a professor at Yeungnam University Medical Center said on Wednesday.

sabcScience.headline: Short-term ventilator sharing may be viable for COVID-19 patients – Study
sabcScience.lede: Ventilators could be safely shared by two COVID-19 patients for up to two days, a small US study found, validating an experimental method followed by hospitals struggling to handle the onslaught of lung failure cases with limited equipment.

sabcScience.headline: ‘SA needs Cuban health workers amid COVID-19’
sabcScience.lede: PSAM says while there are calls for the government to explain the high costs of having Cuban healthcare workers in South Africa - there is a need for further medical services amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

sabcScience.headline: Strong cold front hits Cape Town
sabcScience.lede: A strong cold front has made landfall in the Cape Peninsula, bringing with it heavy rainfall and extremely cold weather.

sabcScience.headline: SA records 82 coronavirus-related deaths for the second day in a row
sabcScience.lede: South Africa has registered 82 COVID-19 related deaths for the second day in a row. The number of confirmed cases has jumped to 52 991 as the recoveries now stand at 29 006, according to the Health Department's latest figures.

sabcScience.headline: Cuban doctors deployed in S Africa to cost taxpayers R239 million
sabcScience.lede: The salaries of the Cuban health workers deployed in South Africa to help in the fight against COVID-19 are estimated to cost taxpayers about R239 million over the duration of their stay, Health Department says.

sabcScience.headline: Life Healthcare hit by cyber attack
sabcScience.lede: Life Healthcare said on Tuesday its southern African operation was hit by a cyber attack affecting its admissions systems, business processing systems and email servers.

sabcSport.headline: Japan winger Fukuoka skipping Olympics to begin medical studies
sabcSport.lede: Winger Kenki Fukuoka, who helped Japan reach the Rugby World Cup quarter-finals last year, has said he will not be available for the rugby sevens tournament at the Tokyo Olympics as he will be studying for medical school.

sabcSport.headline: Football must take ‘giant leap’ to fight racism: Neville
sabcSport.lede: Former England international Gary Neville says words are not enough to combat racism in football and that he is “ashamed” he did not fight harder against it when he was a player.

sabcSport.headline: Solskjaer tips keeper Henderson to become England’s No. 1
sabcSport.lede: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has tipped English goalkeeper Dean Henderson to become first choice for club and country after impressing during his loan spell at Sheffield United.

sabcSport.headline: Djokovic breaks down in tears after hosting Belgrade exhibition
sabcSport.lede: An emotional Novak Djokovic could not hold back the tears while hosting a charity event at his tennis complex by the Danube River on Sunday.

sabcSport.headline: Atletico held at Bilbao in blow to top-four hopes
sabcSport.lede: Atletico Madrid drew 1-1 at Athletic Bilbao on Sunday on their return to action after La Liga's three-month hiatus due to the COVID-19 pandemic, missing out on the chance to capitalise on slip-ups by their rivals for Champions League places.

sabcSport.headline: Tshakhuma Tsha Madzivhandila announce purchase of PSL club Bidvest Wits
sabcSport.lede: GladAfrica Championship side, Tshakhuma Tsha Madzivhandila, has confirmed the purchase of Bidvest Wits' ABSA Premiership status has been finalised.

sabcSport.headline: Thousands take part in virtual Comrades race
sabcSport.lede: Thousands of runners are taking part in the world's most inclusive road running event, the Race the Comrades Legends virtual race, on Sunday. The virtual event has been organised in the place of this year's Comrades Marathon.

sabcSport.headline: Player names to be replaced by ‘Black Lives Matter’ when English Premier League resumes
sabcSport.lede: English Premier League players will pay tribute to worldwide anti-racism movements by wearing shirts with the words “Black Lives Matter” on the back during the opening round of fixtures at the season’s restart.

sabcSport.headline: Leganes problems deepen with home defeat to Valladolid
sabcSport.lede: Leganes remain deep in relegation trouble after losing 2-1 at home to Real Valladolid on Saturday in their first La Liga game following a three-month hiatus due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

sabcSport.headline: Italian federation hopes to allow fans in stadiums in July
sabcSport.lede: The head of Italy's football federation (FIGC) hopes that stadiums can be opened to at least some fans next month if the rate of coronavirus infections continues to drop in the country.

sabcSport.headline: Hazard, Asensio back for Real return against Eibar, says Zidane
sabcSport.lede: Real Madrid's joint-record signing Eden Hazard and Spain international Marco Asensio are both fit for the team's first La Liga match in over three months against visitors Eibar on Sunday, coach Zinedine Zidane has said.

sabcSport.headline: Shutdown brings tennis coaches’ struggles to the fore
sabcSport.lede: Financial aid has slowly trickled in for tennis players in the lower echelons of the sport during the COVID-19 shutdown but the vast majority of men and women who coach them for a living have been left to fend for themselves.

sabcSport.headline: Jankovic undecided on future after comeback at Djokovic event
sabcSport.lede: Former world number one Jelena Jankovic is still unsure whether she would resume her tennis career after playing for the first time in nearly three years at fellow Serb Novak Djokovic’s charity tournament on Friday.

sabcSport.headline: SABC to treat sport fans to live tennis games from this Saturday
sabcSport.lede: The South African Broadcasting Corporation (SABC), through its sports channel SABC Sport, has entered into a partnership with the Novak Djokovic Foundation to broadcast the Adria Tour Tennis Series live on SABC TV.

sabcSport.headline: Golf clubs get green light to resume operations
sabcSport.lede: Golf clubs in South Africa can open their doors as soon as Saturday after Sports Minister Nathi Mthethwa gave them the go-ahead.

sabcSport.headline: Harold Varner III and Justin Rose joint leaders at Forth Worth as golf returns to action
sabcSport.lede: Harold Varner III and Justin Rose both fired seven-under-par 63s to share the lead as the US PGA Tour returned to action for the first time in three months due to the COVID-19 pandemic at the Colonial Country Club in Fort Worth on Thursday.

sabcSport.headline: Moroe remains under suspension: CSA board
sabcSport.lede: The Cricket South Africa (CSA) board says Thabang Moroe remains suspended as CEO, pending the outcome of an inquiry.

sabcSport.headline: West Indies cricket captain grateful team can play amid COVID-19 pandemic
sabcSport.lede: The West Indies captain, Jason Holder, believes that his team has a lot to be thankful for with being able to play professional cricket and getting paid to do so while the ongoing coronavirus pandemic wreaks financial havoc.

sabcSport.headline: Everton players accept wage deferrals to help soften COVID-19 blow
sabcSport.lede: Everton’s first team players have agreed to defer up to 50% of their wages for the next three months to help mitigate the financial impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, the English Premier League club’s chief executive said.

sabcSport.headline: Man City boss Guardiola turns to mentor Lillo to fill Arteta void
sabcSport.lede: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has appointed his mentor and coaching inspiration Juan Manuel Lillo as his new assistant, the Premier League club said.

sabcSport.headline: Hoffenheim midfielder Samassekou backs George Floyd protests
sabcSport.lede: Hoffenheim midfielder Diadie Samassekou has welcomed the Bundesliga’s solidarity with players protesting the death of George Floyd, but does not believe matches should be abandoned when fans hurl racist abuse.

sabcSport.headline: No Tiger and no fans as PGA Tour returns with strong lineup
sabcSport.lede: Tiger Woods and the fans will be missing when golf returns this week after a three-month hiatus due to the novel coronavirus but the Charles Schwab Challenge will otherwise get the full major treatment with a strong field on display.

sabcSport.headline: Man Utd cancel friendly after Stoke boss tests positive for COVID-19
sabcSport.lede: Manchester United’s friendly against Stoke City was cancelled at the last minute on Tuesday after the Championship club’s manager Michael O’Neill tested positive for COVID-19.

sabcSport.headline: Tennis star Osaka in no mood to back down on support for Black Lives Matter
sabcSport.lede: Naomi Osaka, the world’s highest paid sportswoman, says the voices of prominent athletes can be more influential than those of politicians and is determined that hers will be heard on the subject of racial injustice.

sabcSport.headline: Federer out for rest of 2020 season after second knee surgery
sabcSport.lede: Roger Federer will miss the rest of the 2020 tennis season after undergoing a second knee surgery few weeks ago, the winner of 20 Grand Slam singles titles said on Wednesday.

sabcSport.headline: Leverkusen beat minnows to book place in German Cup final
sabcSport.lede: Bayer Leverkusen beat lowly Saarbruecken 3-0 away on Tuesday to reach next month’s German Cup final and bring the fairytale run of the fourth division side to a jolting end.

sabcSport.headline: Im taking nothing for granted despite long Fedex Cup reign
sabcSport.lede: Im Sung-jae has enjoyed a longer run at the top of the Fedex Cup standings than many better-known players but the South Korean is taking nothing for granted as he plots his return to PGA Tour action in Texas this week.

sabcSport.headline: A decade on, South Africa insists World Cup worth investment
sabcSport.lede: Thursday marks 10 years since South Africa hosted a FIFA World Cup highly charged with symbolism but dogged by questions about the wisdom of spending billions on a sports event that might have been better used elsewhere.

sabcSport.headline: BCCI wants quick decision on fate of T20 World Cup
sabcSport.lede: Uncertainty surrounding this year’s Twenty20 World Cup in Australia due to the COVID-19 pandemic has created a scheduling headache and a decision should be made as quickly as possible, a top Indian cricket board official told Reuters.

sabcSport.headline: SARU working out ways to get rugby back on track
sabcSport.lede: SARU says it is hard at work to get both international and domestic rugby back up and running, as soon as possible.
